H0.text: Hydrogen bonds are the forces that attach pairs of nitrogenous bases to each other.

H1.text: Potassium bonds are the bonds that attach pairs of nitrogenous bases to each other.

H2.text: Ionic bonds attach pairs of nitrogenous bases to each other.

H3.text: Magnetism is the force by which pairs of nitrogenous bases are attached to each other.

A4.text: The double helical structure of DNA is due largely to hydrogen bonding between its base pairs, which link one complementary strand to the other and enable replication.
